meanings.definition: Having the most bounce or elasticity.
meanings.sent1: The rubber ball was the bounciest one in the store.
meanings.sent2: The puppy with the bounciest tail wagged happily.
meanings.sent3: The bounciest mattress made it hard to get out of bed in the morning.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was like the bounciest trampoline, always lifting spirits.
meanings.sent5: The bounciest clouds in the sky looked like fluffy pillows.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a lively and energetic manner.
meanings.sent1: The bounciest child in the class always brought joy to others.
meanings.sent2: The music at the party had the bounciest rhythm, making everyone dance.
meanings.sent3: His bounciest behavior at the meeting lightened the serious mood.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the bounciest melody in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bounciest squirrel in the park entertained the visitors.

meanings.definition: Capable of rebounding or springing back.
meanings.sent1: The bounciest ball bounced the highest among all the toys.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast's routine was the bounciest, impressing the audience.
meanings.sent3: The bounciest rubber band in the office caused a playful distraction.
meanings.sent4: His spirit was the bounciest, never staying down for long.
meanings.sent5: The bounciest balloon soared into the sky with joy.
